reviews.text: I stayed here with friends for our girls trip. We were a bit skeptical at first (we had booked a room elsewhere, but were sent here because of the first hotel's error), but our fears were soon put to rest after encountering the warm and friendly staff. The room we had was not spectacular, but it was clean and inexpensive. The best part of this spot was the outdoor seating area. They have outdoor tables and chairs lined around the path to the rooms, which is surrounded by tropical flowers and plants (a teeny little paradise). Since we also had a refrigerator in the room, this helped to make our trip even more economical (by stocking up at the liquor store, having cold drinks and a nice place to enjoy them), which is very much appreciated in over-priced Miami. There is a gate that keeps out non-guests of the Riviere, which gave three girls traveling alone a sense of security. While they didn't have all the amenities that a hotel might have (no ice machine, no room service, no dry cleaning service, etc.), they really made up for it with their friendliness and helpfulness. The Riviere was within walking distance of the beach, great bars (Love/Hate was our favorite), and tons of restaurants(News Cafe was the best). I would stay here again while visiting Miami.
reviews.title: Would prefer to stay in a hotel next time

reviews.text: On arrival we were allocated a very small room which had a double bed and a single bed squeezed into it. I spoke to the guy who booked us in and he told me "but there's only 3 of you", I showed him that we had booked and paid for 2 double beds. He said there were no other rooms available (don't know if this was true - as I had just seen him put a "rooms available" sign up outside!) and that we could move tomorrow at 2pm, and he told us the apartment number.
reviews.title: Top location, clean, friendly - for a party vacation

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights for a friend's bachelor party. Clean, comfortable rooms with a mini-fridge and microwave. The beds were adequately comfortable and noise from the outside was minimal. If you book well in advance, the room rates can't be beat. All in all a hidden gem of South Beach with decent service and clean rooms all at a reasonable price.
reviews.title: TA Reviews Are Correct - Hidden Gem of South Beach

reviews.text: We stayed in a studio room with two queen sized beds. Although the accommodation was a bit cramp it was more than adequate as we were staying for 3 nights only. It is close to all the shops, clubs, beach etc. Parking is available a couple of blocks down (corner of 13th St at $15/day). Found the staff very friendly (Ramon) who helped out with any queries that we had regarding the general area. The rooms are entered via a gate which basically keeps the local homeless out of the property and provides a certain feel of security. Our room was at the back of the property near the space for the trash bins which was not to impressive, however being so far from the front, it was quieter. Overall I would recommend the place for a short stay in view of the location and rates.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: I went here as part of a group of 6 people on our college spring break. We stayed in the 1 bedroom apartment which had 2 queen sized beds, 1 twin bed & a love seat. The apartment also had a full kitchen for cooking. We ended up paying a great price, especially since the hotel doesn't charge extra person fees & we saved money on food from making a few meals in our kitchen. The staff was very helpful, supplying us with extra towels & sheets on a consistent basis. The location was really great because we could walk to all the clubs, bars, shops, restaurants, the beach & the strip. We didn't need a car or cab for the 5 nights that we stayed there.
reviews.title: Great Value and Very Spacious

reviews.title: we will never comeback to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I too had read the reviews for this hotel. It is what others have previously written. It's a block off the beach - perfect location. There is a front gate that you need a key for in order to get to your rooms (so it is safe), the rooms are a bit dated and the bathroom was just ok but the place was clean. I got the room for $79 a night - and it was definately value for $. The front desk staff was also very helpful with advising where to park in order to minimize our expense.
reviews.title: budget hotel meets heart of South Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great weekend staying at the Riviere. As stated location is very good and accommodation was fine for our needs. Would definitely stay here next visit to Miami. Thanks to others for the recommendation.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Rivierer 8/5-8/12/08. We loved that it was close to the beach, shops and nightlife. We could walk to almost everything we wanted to do. Yes the walls are thin, and it is not a 5 star hotel but Sergio and the other staff (including the Myster Man night clerk) were very friendly and helpful. For a girls getaway it was great. We made breakfast in the morning and was able to heat up leftovers for lunch. Cheap drinks at Wet Willies, great bartenders at Dreams and good food at Big Pinks. If you want to spend your money on something other than your hotel room (and you will in SOBE) stay here.
reviews.title: Give it a try

reviews.text: I was initially a bit skeptical of staying at the Riviere but this place definitely exceeded my expectations. The location is phenomenal...walking distance to the beach, nightlife, restaurants. Great stay if you are looking for an economical, no frills, comfortable place to crash. Bedroom is not huge but sufficient. Also comes with a full kitchen including fridge/microwave/utensils. The front office management is very responsive and accomodating.
reviews.title: Central South Beach location, comfortable, clean, accessible staff, highly economical

reviews.text: I did a lot of research on where to stay in Miami Beach before booking the Riviere apart hotel. I eventually chose this hotel firstly because as we stayed for nearly two weeks I wanted the space to live rather than just sleep (many expensive hotels look great but have tiny rooms). We certainly got that with the one bed apartment giving enough space to live permanently let alone holiday with bedroom with two double beds, lounge with seating for upto five people and flat screen TV with cable (80+ channels), dining room, kitchen with cooker, microwave, fridge, freezer and sink and finally a very well equipped bathroom.
reviews.title: Friendly, great location, clean & big
